page.title: 07 Communications
page.content: Situated at one corner of Britain no motorways go through our area. Though the A28 reaches to Margate. We have a network of minor roads linking to Margate and Broadstairs, and the M2 has speeded our journeys to London. Many of our local roads were old country lanes which have never been widened and are consequently very congested at times, especially in summer when the holiday-makers are in Clifftonville. Some newer roads are wider including those built for the trams or the trains which never reached Clifftonville. Most of the roads were badly pot holed during the cold winter of January 1985 when even Pegwell Bay froze over. We are writting this in June 1985 and work is still going on repairing the roads.
